head.title: Executives Shift Roles At Several Agencies

hedline.hl1: Executives Shift Roles At Several Agencies

abstract.p: BBDO Worldwide names Rich Kronengold, New York office executive vice president, to added post of chief marketing officer; Einson Freeman names president Carl Nichols to added post of chief executive; he succeeds Jeffrey K McElnea, who is leaving to become Satmark Sales Co president; McKinsey & Co names Gary Singer principal; Lowe Lintas & Partners names Matt Heller executive vice president on Burger King account (M)

block.p: There are changes involving several top agency executives.

Rich Kronengold, 44, executive vice president at the New York office of BBDO Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group, who oversees accounts like Texaco and Visa and also manages the agency's Houston office, was named to the additional new position of chief marketing officer.
There are changes involving several top agency executives.

Rich Kronengold, 44, executive vice president at the New York office of BBDO Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group, who oversees accounts like Texaco and Visa and also manages the agency's Houston office, was named to the additional new position of chief marketing officer.

Carl Nichols, 44, president at Einson Freeman in Paramus, N.J., part of the WPP Group, was named to the additional post of chief executive. He succeeds Jeffrey K. McElnea, who is leaving to become president at the Satmark Sales Company in New York.

Gary Singer, managing director at the St. Louis office of D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles, part of the B Com3 Group, is leaving to become a principal at McKinsey & Company in New York. Until a successor is named, Mr. Singer, 45, will be replaced on an interim basis by Ron Crooks, executive vice president and executive creative director.

And Matt Heller, 40, was named executive vice president and worldwide client director on the Burger King account at Lowe Lintas & Partners in New York, part of the Lowe Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies. Mr. Heller, who had been executive vice president and managing director for account services, recently absorbed the Burger King duties of Nancy McNally, who had been the general manager at the Lowe Lintas New York office as well as the top executive on the account. Ms. McNally left Lowe Lintas in late March. Burger King is owned by Diageo.
